Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Knowledge not only on vocab and grammar and idioms, but also on Chinese culture and important topics in politics, and the media.
Additional language skills across all fronts.
I saw huge improvements in my grammar and vocabulary. I also learned about Chinese culture and history.
I built upon my Chinese speaking, listening, writing, and reading skills

I developed a much more thorough understanding of the modern Chinese language, as well as engaging with new historical and cultural information. This course gives you experience in discerning formal and informal language, and helps you learn the differences between similar words. I found this focus on word discrimination particularly informative.

Formal Chinese skills, greater knowledge of contemporary Chinese culture, confidence in formal speaking and in giving presentations, skills in writing detailed essays, and character writing/memorization.
Zhou Laoshi is such an incredible professor. Must take this class!

Chinese language skills, ability to develop professional vocabulary talking about political issues such as marriage and immigrants
Chinese essay writing skills, speaking, and listening

I feel that my Chinese improved in all areas of listening, speaking, reading, and writing, while taking this course. I also appreciated how the lesson content also helped us to learn about Chinese history, culture, and contemporary society.
I learned how to give good presentations and think on my feet
Overall great course.
No weaknesses to be spoken of. Zhou Laoshi's teaching method is very engaging, and he obviously cares a great deal about his students and their progress. His handouts are very helpful as well.

This course was amazing! I love the focus on speaking and grammar as opposed to rote character memorization.  We had lots of interesting discussions in class and out of class assignments that tied what we learned to the real world.

I think the class was great overall, my only criticism was that there was a bit too much stress on formal Chinese. Nobody at this level is near fluent, I think it would be a better use of time to learn how to say certain new terms than to learn how to say terms I already know in a different way.

The strengths of this course included the focus on developing different skill sets: not just writing, but reading, speaking, listening, and cultural knowledge. I also thought this class was strong because we did not focus on character writing, so I was able to spend much more of my study time learning grammar structures and vocabulary. One element that could be improved is maybe more evenly distributing work throughout the semester so that there isn't so much to do during test times. Other than that, I thought it was a very well-designed course.
Zhou Laoshi really cares about his students succeeding and truly loves to teach.
Most of it were strengths--well organized and well taught. The only downside was that the sections got too big and there was little time to drill or practice the things learned.

This course has interesting assignments that are enjoyable to complete. I also think that doing the Quizlet many times was a great way to continue reviewing past vocabulary. I think because of that, I am more likely to retain what I learned in this class.
Strength is the homework that reinforces what we have learned in class and the quizlets. It could be improved by more
Yes! Zhou laoshi is so nice, caring, understanding, yet will also push you to try your hardest and practice your Mandarin skills. 10/10.
Yes, definitely. Again, Zhou Laoshi's teaching method is very engaging, and I learned a great deal in the course.
Yes! This course is difficult but its less stressful than lower level Chinese. You will learn a lot and Zhou Laoshi is a wonderful teacher who is always willing to help.
Yes, for anyone who is serious about continuing their Chinese education
I would recommend this course to anybody who wants to expand their knowledge of Chinese. The professor is excellent and class is very fun.
Absolutely. Zhou Laoshi is fantastic.
Yes!! Must take this class!
I would absolutely recommend this course as hands down the best Chinese class I ever took.
I would recommend this course to another student because the content is interesting and the classroom environment is very positive.
Yes, great way to continue your Chinese study and manageable. Worth it
